intro: Verticordia citrella, commonly known as the Lemon-scented Verticordia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, lemon-scented leaves and vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathland environments. Its unique floral structure consists of two prominent, recurved petals and a prominent central column. Verticordia citrella is a rare and ecologically significant species, often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
